support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with NBN (NBS1), a component of the MRN DNA damage sensing complex, to facilitate DNA repair processes.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 interacts with NBN (NBS1), a critical component of the MRN complex that is responsible for recruiting and activating the ATM kinase at sites of DNA double-strand breaks.
functions.effect_description: This interaction suggests ATXN3 may play a role in the activation of the DNA damage response cascade by modulating the function of the MRN complex and its ability to signal downstream to effectors like ATM.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds NBN -> Potential modulation of MRN-dependent ATM activation -> Regulation of cell cycle checkpoints and DNA repair

mechanism: ATXN3 interacts with NBN (NBS1), a critical component of the MRN complex that is responsible for recruiting and activating the ATM kinase at sites of DNA double-strand breaks.
effect: This interaction suggests ATXN3 may play a role in the activation of the DNA damage response cascade by modulating the function of the MRN complex and its ability to signal downstream to effectors like ATM.
summary: ATXN3 interacts with NBN to modulate dna damage signaling.
